info.title: Mimoto
info.summary: A backend service that acts as a proxy for Inji Wallet, handles API requests, validations, and manages verifiable credentials (VC)
info.description:
This API document details on the below categories of endpoints
  • Credential Download - OTP Flow: All endpoints that handle generation, request, status check, and download of credentials using OTP
  • Verifiers: Endpoint that retrieves a list of all trusted verifiers.
  • Credentials Download: Endpoints that manage the retrieval and download of credentials
  • Wallet Binding: Endpoints to generate OTP and bind credentials to a wallet
  • Inji Config: Endpoint that retrieves all configurable properties for the Inji application
  • Trusted Issuers: All endpoints that provide data and configuration details for supported issuers
  • Authorize the Verifiable Presentation: Endopint that authorizes verifiable presentations and handles related responses
Abbreviations:

OTP - One Time Password

post.description:
This endpoint allows a user to request an OTP for credential generation. The OTP can be sent through multiple channels like email or phone, based on the provided `otpChannel` in the request. The system will send the OTP to the masked email or phone number associated with the provided individual ID.

This is part of the process to initiate credential verification in the system, ensuring that the individual has access to the notification channels specified.

id.description: Unique identifier for the OTP request

version.description: The version of the OTP request API.

str.description: A status message related to the OTP request. May be null if no additional info is available.

responsetime.description: The timestamp when the OTP request was processed.

metadata.description: Additional metadata associated with the OTP request. May be null if no metadata is provided.

maskedMobile.description: The partially masked mobile number to which the OTP was sent (e.g., XXXXXX6677).

maskedEmail.description: The partially masked email address to which the OTP was sent (e.g., XXuXXrXX5XX9@gmail.com).

errorCode.description: A code identifying the error that occurred, if any.

errorMessage.description: A descriptive message detailing the error, if any.

get.description:
This API retrieves all trusted verifiers for Inji Wallet. 
Verifiers are entities that are trusted to verify the authenticity of credentials in the wallet. 
The returned list includes the client details, redirect URIs, and response URIs associated with each verifier.

200.description: Returns a list of trusted verifiers and their details.

verifiers.description: A list of trusted verifiers for Inji Wallet.

client_id.description:
The unique identifier (URL) of the client verifier.
This ID is used to identify and authenticate the client in the system.

redirect_uris.description: A list of URIs where the client expects to receive the redirect after a successful verification.

response_uris.description: A list of URIs where the client expects to receive the response after processing the verification request.

post.description:
This endpoint allows you to retrieve the access token in exchange for
the authorization code provided during the OIDC flow. The token returned 
can be used to authenticate and authorize subsequent requests to the service.

parameters.name: arg0
parameters.description:
A set of query parameters that are required for the token exchange process.
These parameters will typically include the authorization code or other necessary data.

parameters.name: issuer
parameters.description:
The identifier of the issuer for which the access token is being requested.
This should match the issuer registered in the system and is used to validate the token request.

200.description: OK - Successfully retrieved the access token

id.description: The unique identifier for the response.

version.description: The version of the response schema.

str.description: A custom field that might contain additional string-based information (can be null).

responsetime.description: The timestamp of when the response was generated.

metadata.description: Additional metadata about the response, if available.

access_token.description: The access token that can be used for authentication and authorization in subsequent requests. This token follows the standard OAuth2.0 bearer token format.

expires_in.description:
The time in seconds for which the access token is valid.
After this time, the token will need to be refreshed or reissued.

scope.description: The scope of the access token, which defines what resources or actions the token allows access to.

refresh_token.description:
A refresh token that can be used to obtain a new access token after the old one expires. 
This field may be null if a refresh token is not provided.

errorCode.description: A code representing the error that occurred.

400.description: Bad Request - The request was malformed or missing necessary parameters

post.description:
This endpoint allows a user to request a new credential. The request requires an OTP for verification, which was previously generated in the OTP flow. The credential request is processed and stored in the system for further actions. The request requires the `individualId`, `otp`, `transactionID`, and the `user` requesting the credential.

The system verifies the OTP and transaction ID, and if valid, processes the credential generation. The response includes the status of the request and may contain an error message in case of failure.

individualId.description: The unique identifier for the individual requesting the credential, typically used in identity systems (e.g., UIN, Aadhar).

otp.description: The OTP sent to the user for verification. It is used to authenticate the user requesting the credential.

transactionID.description: The unique identifier associated with the transaction that initiated the OTP request. It ensures that the request is valid and matches the previous OTP request.

user.description: The user requesting the credential. This could represent the application or system entity making the request on behalf of the individual.

id.description: The unique identifier for the credential request (e.g., mosip.resident.vid).

version.description: The version of the credential request process (e.g., v1).

str.description: A status message related to the credential request. May be null if no additional info is available.

responsetime.description: The timestamp when the credential request was processed, in ISO 8601 format.

metadata.description: Additional metadata associated with the credential request. May be null if no metadata is provided.

id.description: The unique identifier of the individual requesting the credential.

requestId.description: The unique identifier for this credential request generated by the system.

errorCode.description: The error code that identifies the problem with the request, if any.

errorMessage.description: A descriptive message detailing the error encountered during the request.

errors.errorMessage: Input transactionID does not match transactionID of OTP Request

get.summary: Generate Credential - Check Status of Credential Share
get.description:
This endpoint allows users to check the status of a previously requested credential. It requires the `requestId` of the credential request, which was generated when the request was made.

If the request is successfully processed, the system will return the current status along with any relevant error details if applicable.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the credential request. This ID is generated when the credential request is initially made and is used to track the status of the request.

id.description: The unique identifier of the individual requesting the credential. This ID corresponds to the one used in the original request.

requestId.description: The unique identifier of the credential request. This value is provided when the request is initially made and is used to track the request's progress.

statusCode.description: The current status of the credential request.

errors.description: A list of errors encountered during the processing of the credential request, if any. This is empty if the request is successful.

errors.errorMessage: Credential request processing failed due to an internal error.

post.description:
This endpoint is used to download a Verifiable Credential based on the provided `requestId`. 
It accepts a request containing the individual’s `requestId` and `individualId` to retrieve the credential. 
If the requested VC exists, it returns both the decrypted credential and the original encrypted credential. 
If any issue occurs (e.g., no credential is found), it returns a `NOT_FOUND` status.

individualId.description:
The unique identifier of the individual who is requesting the download of the verifiable credential. 
This ID is typically assigned to an individual when they register or authenticate.

requestId.description:
The unique identifier for the specific credential request. This value is generated when the request is made to download the credential. 
The `requestId` is used to track and retrieve the credential.

post.summary: Callback API - Notify when credential is ready
post.description:
This callback URI is used by WebSub to notify when a credential has been generated and is ready. 
It is triggered when a subscribed event has occurred, such as the completion of a credential generation process.

This API is used to generate an OTP for wallet binding. It acts as a proxy to call the 
[Identity Provider - Send Binding OTP Endpoint](https://mosip.stoplight.io/docs/identity-provider/a34e5371d4876-send-binding-otp-endpoint-draft) 
API internally.

The OTP is used to verify the user's identity during the wallet binding process.

requestTime.description: The timestamp when the OTP request is made.

individualId.description:
The individual identifier used for verification. This can be a UIN (Universal
Identity Number) or VID (Verified Identity).

otpChannels.description:
A list of OTP channels that will be used to notify the user. 
Possible values include EMAIL, PHONE.

individualId.description: The individual identifier used for verification (UIN or VID).

individualIdType.description: The type of individual identifier (UIN or VID).

otp.description: The OTP that is to be sent to the user.

vidType.description: The type of the VID (e.g., PERPETUAL).

transactionID.description: The unique identifier for the transaction request.

requestTime.description: The timestamp when the OTP request is made.

individualId.description: The individual identifier used for verification. This can be a UIN or VID.

otpChannels.description: A list of OTP channels for notifying the user (e.g., EMAIL, PHONE).

requestBody.description: The request body contains the details needed to generate an OTP for wallet binding.

id.description: The unique identifier of the response.

version.description: The version of the API response schema.

responsetime.description: The timestamp when the response was generated.

metadata.description: Additional metadata about the response, if any.

maskedEmail.description: The masked email address of the user.

maskedMobile.description: The masked mobile number of the user.

errorCode.description: The error code if an error occurred.

errorMessage.description: The error message explaining the error.

400.description: Bad Request - The request was malformed, missing required parameters, or contained invalid data.

id.description: A unique identifier for the request, useful for tracing.

str.description: Optional string message about the error or request status.

responsetime.description: Timestamp when the response was generated.

metadata.description: Additional information related to the request or error.

response.description: Response body in case of success (null in failure).

errorCode.description: A code representing the error type, e.g., `INVALID_PARAMETER`.

errorMessage.description: A detailed message explaining the error, e.g., `Missing required parameter 'individualId'.`

errors.errorMessage: The parameter `individualId` is required but was not provided.

post.summary: Wallet Binding -  Bind Credential with wallet
post.description:
This api is used to bind the credential   with wallet.
This api is used as a proxy to call [Identity Provider - Wallet binding Endpoint](https://mosip.stoplight.io/docs/identity-provider/6e91115b16311-wallet-binding-endpoint) api internally.

authFactorType.description: Auth factor type to be binded for the provided key.

format.description: Format of the auth factor type supported in the wallet app. Right now Inji supports only jwt.

individualId.description: The individual id. UIN or VID.

publicKey.description: The public key of the wallet app.

authFactorType.description: Defines the type of auth challenge. It should be same as authfactor.type (oauth-details response).

challenge.description: Actual challenge as string. A jwt in case of inji.

certificate.description: Server certificate after successful binding. This certificate will be stored in wallet app.

encryptedWalletBindingId.description: the wallet binding id in encrypted format. The wallet app will associate the requested credential with this id.

expireDateTime.description: expiry date time of the binding.

get.description: Retrieves all configurable properties for Inji.

200.description: Successfully retrieved all configurable properties for Inji.

response.description: The key-value pairs of all the configurable properties for Inji.

additionalProperties.description: The value for each configurable property, which can be a string or a comma-separated list.

errors.description: A list of errors (if any) occurred while retrieving the properties.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description:
Optional search parameter to filter issuers by a specific term. 
If provided, the response will only include issuers whose names or identifiers match the search term.

get.description: This API provides data with a search capability to populate the list of supported issuers in Inji Web. The list will be displayed under the "List of Issuers" section.

issuer_id.description: A unique identifier for the issuer.

protocol.description: The protocol used by the issuer (e g., OpenId4VCI).

url.description: URL to the logo image for the issuer.

alt_text.description: Alt text for the issuer's logo image.

title.description: The title displayed for the issuer.

language.description: The language code for the display text (e.g., "en").

client_id.description: The client ID for the issuer.

wellknown_endpoint.description: URL to the issuer's well-known endpoint.

redirect_uri.description: URI to which the user will be redirected after authentication.

token_endpoint.description: URL to the token endpoint for the issuer.

proxy_token_endpoint.description: URL to the proxy token endpoint for the issuer.

client_alias.description: Alias for the client associated with the issuer.

qr_code_type.description: The type of QR code associated with the issuer, if any.

enabled.description: Indicates whether the issuer is enabled (e.g., "true" or "false").

credential_issuer.description: The name of the credential issuer.

credential_issuer_host.description: The host URL of the credential issuer.

display.name: MOSIP Insurance
display.title: Download via LIC
display.description: Enter your policy number to download your card.

display.name: MOSIP National ID
display.title: Download via LIC
display.description: Enter your policy number to download your card.

get.summary: Get the configuration details for a specific issuer
get.description: This API provides the complete configuration details for the specific issuers passed in the path variable

parameters.name: issuer-id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the issuer whose configuration details are being fetched.

issuer_id.description: The unique identifier of the issuer.

protocol.description: The protocol used for communication (e.g., OpenId4VCI).

name.description: The name of the issuer displayed on the UI.

url.description: The URL to the issuer's logo image.

alt_text.description: Alternative text for the logo image, used for accessibility.

title.description: The title or header displayed for the issuer.

description.description: A description of the issuer and its services.

language.description: The language in which the display information is provided (e.g., en, ar, hi).

client_id.description: The client ID for authenticating with the issuer.

wellknown_endpoint.description: The URL to the issuer's well-known endpoint for configuration discovery.

redirect_uri.description: The URI to which the user will be redirected after authentication.

authorization_audience.description: The audience URI for authorization requests.

token_endpoint.description: The URL to the token endpoint used for issuing tokens.

proxy_token_endpoint.description: The URL to the proxy token endpoint.

client_alias.description: The alias or identifier for the client associated with the issuer.

qr_code_type.description: The type of QR code for the issuer. Options include OnlineSharing, EmbeddedVC, or None.

enabled.description: Indicates whether the issuer is currently enabled for use.

credential_issuer.description: The name of the credential issuer.

credential_issuer_host.description: The host URL for the credential issuer.

code.description: A code representing the error type.

message.description: A human-readable message providing details about the error.

code.description: Error code indicating why the issuer was not found.

message.description: A message explaining the reason for the failure (e.g., invalid issuer ID).

errors.message: Issuer ID not found or invalid.

get.description: This API fetches and allows searching for Credential Types offered by the issuer, all sourced from the issuer's well-known configuration. Since version 0.16.0, this endpoint is deprecated and will be removed in a future release. Use issuers new endpoint issuers/{issuer-id}/configuration instead.

parameters.name: issuer-id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the issuer whose well-known proxy configuration is being fetched.

credential_issuer.description: The URL of the credential issuer providing the credentials.

authorization_servers.description: List of authorization server URLs associated with the issuer.

credential_endpoint.description: The endpoint URL for credential issuance.

format.description: The format of the credential (e.g., ldp_vc, jwt).

scope.description: The scope of the credential (e.g., insurance_vc).

doctype.description: The document type associated with the credential.

proof_signing_alg_values_supported.description: List of supported proof signing algorithms for the credential (e.g., RS256, PS256).

claims.description: A list of claims supported by the credential.

type.description: The types of the credential (e.g., VerifiableCredential, InsuranceCredential).

name.description: The display name of the credential subject.

locale.description: The locale of the display name.

name.description: The name of the issuer or credential type.

locale.description: The locale in which the display information is presented.

url.description: URL of the logo image for the issuer or credential.

alt_text.description: Alternative text for the logo image for accessibility purposes.

background_color.description: Background color associated with the credential's UI.

text_color.description: Text color used in the credential's display.

order.description: The order in which fields should appear in the credential.

logo.alt_text: a square logo of a Veridonia
a square logo of a Veridonia

get.description: Retrieve the required configuration details for a specific issuer and its authorization server from their respective well-known endpoints.

parameters.name: issuer-id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the credential issuer whose configuration is being fetched.

errors.errorMessage:
Invalid Authorization Server well-known from server:
Authorization Server host url cannot be null

grant_type.description: The type of grant being used for authentication. Typically 'authorization_code'.

code.description: The authorization code received after user authentication.

redirect_uri.description: The URI to which the response will be sent after the token request.

code_verifier.description: The code verifier used in PKCE (Proof Key for Code Exchange) to secure the authorization code flow.

issuer.description: The issuer of the credential (e.g., Mosip).

credential.description: The type of credential being requested (e.g., MosipVerifiableCredential).

vcStorageExpiryLimitInTimes.description: The expiration limit in terms of time for the verifiable credential. Default is '-1'.

locale.description: The locale/language preference for the downloaded credential. For example, 'en' for English.

post.summary: Download a Verifiable Credential (VC) as a PDF
post.description: This API is responsible for generating PDFs for the received VC content. It fetches display properties from the well-known configuration of the issuer and incorporates them into the predefined template of the PDF file.

200.description: Successfully generated the credential as a PDF.

400.description: Bad Request - The request could not be processed due to invalid input or other issues.

get.description: This endpoint is responsible for authorizing a verifiable presentation request.  The user is redirected with the authorization token or an error message, based on the outcome.

302.description:
Found

**Success Case :**

```json

{redirectUri}#vp_token={base64_encoded_vpToken}&presentation_submission={url_encoded_presentation_submission}

```
**Error Case :** 

```json

{redirectUri}?error={error_codes}&error_messages={error_messages}

```


**Possible Error Codes and Error Messages :**

- **invalid_request** - "Some incorrect parameters in the request"
- **unsupported_format** - "No VC of this format is found"
- **resource_not_found** - "The requested resource doesn’t exist."
- **server_unavailable** - "The server is not reachable right now."
- **resource_expired** - "The requested resource expired."
- **resource_invalid** - "The requested resource is invalid."
- **request_timed_out** - "We are unable to process your request right now"
- **uri_too_long** - "Resource URI is too long to be handled"
- **invalid_client** - "The requested client doesn’t match."
- **invalid_redirect_uri** - "The requested redirect URI doesn’t match."
- **internal_server_error** - "We are unable to process request now"

parameters.name: resource
parameters.description: The URL-encoded resource URL of the credential being requested

parameters.name: presentation_definition
parameters.description: The URL-encoded presentation definition to validate the presentation request

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: The client ID of the registered verifier making the request

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: One of the redirect URIs of the registered verifier

credentials_supported.description: A list of credentials that are supported by the issuer.

authorization_endpoint.description: The URI endpoint for authorization requests.

grant_types_supported.description: The types of grants supported for authorization.

errors.description: A list of errors that occurred, if any.

response.description: The response object, which may be null in case of an error.

errors.description: A list of errors encountered while processing the request.

scope.description: The scope of the credential, which defines the resource access or permission.

display.description: A list of display options for the credential, including localization settings.

name.description: The name of the credential to be displayed (e.g., "Health Insurance").

locale.description: The locale or language code for the display name (e.g., "en" for English).

logo.description: The URL of the logo to be displayed for the credential.

errorMessage.description: A detailed message describing the error.

individualId.description: The unique identifier of the individual.

individualIdType.description: The type of the individual's ID (e.g., "Aadhaar", "Passport").

otp.description: The one-time password (OTP) sent to the individual.

vidType.description: The type of the VID being generated.

transactionID.description: The unique transaction identifier for tracking.

individualId.description: The unique identifier of the individual.

individualIdType.description: The type of the individual's ID (e.g., "Aadhaar", "Passport").

otpChannel.description: A list of channels through which OTP is sent (e.g., "SMS", "Email").

transactionID.description: The unique transaction identifier for tracking.

individualId.description: The unique identifier of the individual requesting the credential.

otp.description: The one-time password (OTP) for authenticating the request.

transactionID.description: The unique transaction identifier for tracking.

credentialType.description: The type of credential being requested (e.g., "InsuranceCredential").

individualId.description: The unique identifier of the individual requesting the credential download.

requestId.description: The identifier of the request for tracking purposes.

JsonNode.description: A generic object to represent any JSON node. Can be used for any JSON structure.

StringNode.description: A generic string node, can be used for string-based values in a JSON structure.

id.description: The unique identifier of the event.

transactionId.description: The unique transaction identifier associated with the event.

timestamp.description: The timestamp when the event occurred.

dataShareUri.description: The URI where data related to the event can be accessed.

data.description: Additional data related to the event, in an arbitrary key-value structure.

publisher.description: The publisher or system that emitted the event.

topic.description: The topic or subject of the event (e.g., "CredentialIssued").

publishedOn.description: The timestamp when the event was published.

namespace.description: The namespace under which the event type is defined (e.g., "com.example").

name.description: The name of the event type (e.g., "CredentialIssued").

message.description: A message providing more information about the response (e.g., "Operation completed successfully").

aid.description: The unique identifier of the aid request.

otp.description: The one-time password (OTP) sent to the individual for verification.

transactionID.description: The unique transaction identifier for tracking purposes.
